These individuals are not immune to the allure of financial gain or personal protection. A well-placed bribe, a discreet offer of a future position, or a carefully timed favor can often secure their cooperation.

I ensure that my associates understand the consequences of disloyalty. Some may be coerced through threats to their families or their careers. Others are simply too greedy to refuse. I cultivate relationships in private, over drinks or dinners, where loyalty is discussed in hushed tones. It is not enough to have allies; they must believe that their own survival and prosperity depend on me.

I also cultivate connections outside the government—businessmen, smugglers, and traffickers who operate in the shadows. They provide the logistical framework, and I provide the legal cover. In return, I take a cut. It's a delicate balance, but one that has served me well.
